Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling

(2) Summary

API Management has come a long way, starting from being specifically about securing and managing API endpoints to a much bigger scope today. At one stage, "Full Lifecycle API Management" was assumed to be a new trend, but initially it felt a bit like we were entering an age of "API Management Monoliths". What's the alternative, and what can you do to make sure that you are not painting yourself into an API management corner? Welcome to the great unbundling, a trend that we have seen over the last years where we see a flourishing ecosystem of focused and specialized tools. At the same time, their openness ensures that these tools can be combined freely so that everybody can easily build their very own "Full Lifecycle API Management" solution.



Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling

(9) From the Human Web to the Machine Web

  • 1990: First server at CERN
  • 1993: NCSA releases Mosaic browser
  • 1995: Amazon
  • 1998: Extensible Markup Language (XML)
  • 2000: SOAP
  • 2000: "Internet as a Service": Salesforce, eBay, Amazon
  • 2003: "Building Blocks": Delicious, Flickr, Facebook, Twitter, Foursquare, Twilio


A Brief History of API Management Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling

(16) Diversity in the API Space

  • More API styles
  • More deployment models
  • Larger set of API users
  • Growing landscape of service providers

But … What Does That Mean? Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling

(26) API Developers

  • Learn about API trends and tooling
  • Explore and possibly challenge API guardrails
  • Talk to your platform team: It's good for everybody


But … What Does That Mean? Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling

(27) API Platformers

  • Build open platforms that can grow and evolve
  • Observe and explore the ever-evolving API landscape
  • Screen tooling for automation and composition capabilities


But … What Does That Mean? Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling

(28) API Vendors

  • Drink your own champagne and practice API-First
  • Use openness as differentiation: Not everybody has it
  • Create stories that contextualize your product: Show the bigger picture


But … What Does That Mean? Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling

(29) AI all the APIs

  1. APIs for data ingestion for LLMs
    • Data contracts with clear terms of service
  2. APIs for consumption by LLMs
    • Patterns and standards for AI-friendly APIs
  3. APIs for LLM-powered services
    • Metadata for provenance and limitations
  4. LLM-powered services for API management
    • The Great Unbundling (API all the APIs [API all the APIs (1)])

Conclusions Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling

(31) The Great Unbundling is Happening

  • Accept the growing complexity of the API space
  • Embrace the increasing richness of the API space
  • What we need are better ways to make tools talk


Conclusions Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: The New API Stack: The Great Unbundling
